At the beginning of today's class, I could not stand firm with my feet together. Towards the end, when you asked us to stand with our feet together on the last pose, I felt more grounded and I felt proud of myself!

It was my first time to hear the saying "The mat is your reflection". When noticed that I had a harder time grounding or keeping my balance when I closed my eyes compared to when I gazed on somewhere, I realized that it somehow reflected my extroverted personality. At that point I realized the saying was true. It is a constant challenge for me to find grounding in life on my own and without other people. It is more natural for me to try to look out for other's opinion than to reflect on my own experiences and opinion. It is honestly not a bad thing that I am this way, but I would like to take it as a challenge to learn to let go, trust myself more and find grounding on my own.

Like what I said before, I saw how I improved from the beginning to the end of today's class and I felt proud of myself. I remember that each individual goes through life and grows as a person at their own pace, like me, and so I should respect mine. Thank you for your guidance Adrienne!
